name: Catina Saigon Hotel

reviews.title: Convenient!
reviews.text: Located in a very convenient place, near tourist spots and shops.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel rooms are very clean, however the lobby are very small but the staff are very friendly. Very recommended place to stay in hcmc.
reviews.title: Great hotel - excellent value for money

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very impressed with this hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful and very professional. Our room did not have a window but we only really noticed the lack in the mornings - but as we were out every day it was not a problem. The room was furnished to a high standard - the bed was the comfiest we had all trip - and the cleanliness faultless. As other reviewers have said, the location is great - District 1 and all the main tourist sites within walking distance. Good free wifi connection in our room.
reviews.title: Not too bad at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Freindly staff, good room ( I had a room with a window) , good room service. It's not the Hilton but neither is the price. Good value for money
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights with my wife and highly recommend this hotel. Rooms are five star quality without the price and the location is probably one of the best in Saigon. Rooms are a bit small, and there was no window, but all was very clean with high quality furnishings. Breakfast was great and a very pleasant surprise at the price. I have stayed at most of the higher end hotels in Saigon, and can honestly say I prefer this hotel. Don't spend the extra money unless you need a pool or gym.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel with good service

reviews.text: almost new hotel. a/c quiet, working great. room emmaculate and huge. bed huge and comfortable. towels thick. bathroom small but top of the line fixtures. breakfast small selection but excellent service. located in very safe part of town. stayed at windsor for one night and it was no comparison in terms of facilites, service, location. Windsor did have bigger breakfast selection. only downside is no windows, but it was dark and quiet..perfect for sleep. only wish they had free wi fi in room
reviews.title: beautiful botique hotel with las vegas like ammenities in vietnam

reviews.text: The room is clean, with double lock facility on the door. Good service as well. Provides breakfast with stay
reviews.title: Clean, at convinoent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were originally in the Renaissance but checked in here for our last 2 nights, we got B&B for $90 which for its location is excellent. Its a new hotel and we happened to notice it one night walking back to the R, the place is brand new, white and very clean and modern and the front desk staff and the breakfast staff were so accommodating, not like the Renaissance.
reviews.title: A little gem beside all the expensive 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't agree more with the prior reviews. This boutique hotel is wonderful. It's location is perfect. Rooms are very modern with excellent beds and amenities. A newspaper is provided in the morning. The free breakfast can't be beat: dim sum, pho to order, eggs to order, waffles to order, fruit, various hot dishes in a very nice setting. The best breakfast that we've run into in Vietnam.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This little boutique hotel has a great location on Dong Khoi Street. Restaurants and attractions are a few minutes walk away. Wonderful hotel with great breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. When next in Saigon, I'll be staying here again.
reviews.title: Fabulous Gem of Saigon

reviews.text: Stayed at Catina for a total of 5 nights in Jan 2010. Hotel is very well situated just opposite the Sheraton at the posh end of town (which I much prefer to the backpacker district) - most of the sights are within walking distance. Staff very friendly and welcoming as because this is a small hotel you get the personal service which is so often lacking in the larger establishments (reception manager booked me another hotel in Mui Ne and in general showed much appreciated commercial acumen). Standard rooms are a good size with all the facilities you'd expect from a hotel in this category. Breakfast buffet is good. Twin rooms are all windowless which is slightly disconcerting at first - but then again how much time do you spend in your room during the day anyway? And no window also means quiet and excellent for getting a good night's sleep (welcome respite from the traffic outside). Internet booking will secure the best rates here. Only negative is that the doormen hailed a very pricy taxi to take me to the airport - make sure you take a reputable taxi firm like VinaSun.
reviews.title: Catina is all of boutique, value for money, friendly

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during Christmas with our young daughter. We stayed in a junior suite and the room was huge with a huge king size bed. Just nice for the three of us. The bathroom was a good size. Linen and towels were plush. The hotel is like a boutique hotel which is small and personal. The lobby is small and the staff were always friendly and made a huge effort to show our daughter lots of attention. Breakfast is at the restaurant on the second floor which has a nice view overlooking the street. It was nice to watch people going about their early morning activities while relaxing over breakfast. Food was of a high standard. Minimal choices but good all the same. Laundry and minibar prices were expensive like most hotels. Location was excellent. Located centrally and we could walk everywhere. Only negative was our room was right next to the lift and on Christmas Eve the hotel seemed noisier than usual as there was a hotel party being held in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Modern, quiet hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in the Junior Suite. The room was superb. I would have chosen the deluxe room had I not been mislead by the hotel saying that only the Junior Suite had a shower. They meant only the Suite had a shower cubicle (huge cubicle though). All the rooms actually have a shower over the bath.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms but lousy lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a friend who had stayed here previously. The hotel location is really great and a perfect home base for sightseeing in Ho Chi Minh City. The room itself was quite spacious, including individual controls for the air conditioning unit in the room. Free wi-fi and breakfast were included in our room rate. The hotel staff was very friendly and was very diligent about keeping the room clean.
reviews.title: Great stay overall, location can't be beat.

reviews.text: The breakfast was actually quite substantial, including many options typical in an asian hotel (fresh fruit, fried rice and stewed vegetables). In addition, each guest was allowed one free main course breakfast option. There was a tiny sign about main course options and the food options displayed on a tray when you walk into the dining room. You had to order this option though. When we stayed you could choose between an omelet, a waffle, or pho. We tried all three during our stay and each were good.
reviews.title: Small hotel with first class service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend that travelers arrange an airport pick-up through the hotel. I have a friend who lives in Ho Chi Minh City and she warned me that it can be difficult to find reputable taxis at the airport. I emailed the Catina hotel in advance and they were happy to arrange an airport pick-up for $30 one-way. This is pretty expensive, I realize, but it was worth it to me to preserve peace of mind. I hate the hassle of worrying that the taxi driver is taking me on the scenic route to maximize the fare.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and helpful staff at the front desk, as well as comfortable rooms at a very reasonable price. In District One, so close to all of the shops as well as numerous bars and restaurants. Close to the Ferry Terminal and at least one taxi always on standby outside. I have never had a bad experience and will use this hotel as my stopover during work for years to come.
reviews.title: The Catina Hotel can compete with the luxury hotel chains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Catina Hotel is definitely the place to stay in Ho Chi Minh if you are looking for a hotel that is affordable, comfortable and right smack in the city in District 1. The rooms are spacious, bright and clean. The amenities provided are surprisingly excellent especially with the price that they charge for the rooms. It also has the best location and is surrounded by all the five star hotels such as the Caravelle hotel, Intercontinental Asiana and lastly, the Park Hyatt. Its location makes it easy to get around by foot for shopping to Ben Thanh market, the malls, and eating out at all the must try restaurants. I totally recommend this place and will stay at this hotel in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Affordable hotel in top location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time at Catina! Conveniently situated near to all the main attractions. Rooms were Large and spacious with all the services a 4 star hotel has but for a fraction of the price. Specail thanks to Ms Van who assisted us throughout our stay. We will definately be Back!
reviews.title: Enjoyable and comfortable stay

reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. I did not encounter a single insect or bug at all while we stayed there for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great 3 stars hotel

reviews.text: The service was great considering this is a 3 stars hotel. They're polite and speak decent English.
reviews.title: Great small hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: The breakfast was great too. I think it's top 3 for a 3 stars hotel. They do a proper sunny side up (not many 3 stars hotel can do this surprisingly).
reviews.title: Great value & location

reviews.text: Location is fantastic, a lot of restaurant around, walking distance to a lot of shops and attractions. Even if you have to catch a taxi, it's easy from this hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptional service, great location, boutique feel, great rooms

reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights in this hotel, took very good care of us, excellent location, centrally located, but very quiet, so the sleep quality is good. On the first day they delivered a giant birthday cake while my daughter had her birthday a few days earlier. The breakfast was okay, and the staff worked well either they could a little bit improve their english, but that's all over Vietnam a problem even the fact that people are a little bit suspicious, trust each other is difficult for them, also in this htel where they missed one little towel in one of the 2 rooms we used. Really, trust the client, I don' t need on such a trip a 30-30 cm towel. They didn't in the end charge me for the towel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: With such a service location and staff real good value for money.
reviews.title: wonderful welcome to Vietnam

reviews.text: The people at this hotel could not have been more helpful, they were a wonderful introduction to the country and people. Everyone we dealt with spoke good English, they were attentive and very keen to ensure that we had a good holiday. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day and the bedsheets were so beautiful to sleep on that we tried to buy some to bring home. The location was excellent - right in the heart of District 1 and just a short walk to the river for our trip to the Delta. There was wifi in the room and also a guest computer in the lobby. Can't recommend them highly enough.
reviews.title: A nice quiet hotel in the middle of crazy Saigon

reviews.text: This is a wonder small hotel in busy Saigon. Clean and Quite with an excellent location. The room was spacious and clean. Lots of small affordable restaurants near by. We had trouble with the wifi in the room about 50% of the time, however there is a guess computer in the lobby you can use for free and since the hotel is small there wasn't a wait to use the wifi.
reviews.title: great value great location

reviews.text: A good location for touring Saigon for for small business meetings.
reviews.title: Clean, cosy and great service!

description: The new boutique Catina Saigon Hotel offers our patrons a cozy and pleasant accommodation, with all the luxurious facilities of a high class business hotel. Located in the very centre of Ho Chi Minh city, near Ben Thanh Market, Notre-Dame Cathedral, City Theatre, Municipal Government offices, Parson shopping center, office buildings, shops, bars and restaurants, Catina Saigon Hotel is an ideal place for both businessmen and tourists. Catina Saigon Hotel assures you a comfortable and memorable stay at an unbeatable price
